intro: Mediocalcar cluniforme, commonly known as the flat-leafed rock orchid, is a rare and specialized plant found in rocky, arid environments. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, flat, and often fleshy leaves that help it conserve water. The plant produces small, delicate flowers with intricate patterns, typically in shades of white and green. Its roots are adapted to anchor in crevices and absorb moisture from the limited soil available. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Mediocalcar cluniforme is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
